name: Employed college graduates, by major occupation, sex, ethnicity, race, disability status, and detailed employment sector: 2019
description: Employed college graduates, by major occupation, sex, ethnicity, race, disability status, and detailed employment sector: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: occupation_sex_ethnicity_race_and_disability_status
variableMeasured.description: Occupation, sex, ethnicity, race, and disability status hierarchy

variableMeasured.name: field_business_or_industry_for_profit_business_or_industry
variableMeasured.description: Business Or Industry For Profit Business Or Industry

variableMeasured.name: field_business_or_industry_nonprofit_business_or_industry
variableMeasured.description: Business Or Industry Nonprofit Business Or Industry

variableMeasured.name: field_business_or_industry_self_employed_not_incorporated
variableMeasured.description: Business Or Industry Self Employed Not Incorporated

variableMeasured.name: field_education_2_year_college_or_precollege_educational_institution
variableMeasured.description: Education 2 Year College Or Precollege Educational Institution

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Numbers are rounded to the nearest 1,000. Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Hispanic or Latino may be any race; race categories exclude Hispanic origin. The National Survey of College Graduates asks the degree of difficulty—none, slight, moderate, severe, or unable to do—an individual has in seeing (with glasses), hearing (with hearing aid), walking without assistance, lifting 10 pounds, or concentrating, remembering, or making decisions. Those respondents who answered "moderate," "severe," or "unable to do" for an activity were classified as having a disability.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, National Survey of College Graduates: 2019.
